latestComments.text: @bestbuy is refusing to replace or refund a laptop that was delivered to the wrong address !! Never ever order from @bestbuy THEY DO NOT CARE IF YOUR DELIVERY MAKES IF TO YOU

Charging people 15% 'restocking fee' is the same as penalizing them for coming into your store and spending their money. A flat fee of $25 for items over say $500 value makes more sense but is still not appreciative of your customers. I've spent tens of thousands at BB over the decades and don't typically return items. But you just lost a long time customer over $150 bucks. @bestbuy

I am Brazilian.
On my recent trip to the United States, I visited one of your physical stores and purchased two Amazon gift cards.
I paid using a Crypto.com reloadable debit card.
The balance was removed from my Amazon account, and later I found out that a fraud case had been opened.
I have already contacted your support team twice. I was instructed to reach out to two different email channels, and neither one resolved my issue.
I was also told to call a phone number, but I am Brazilian and I am unable to make international calls to the U.S.
It is now 2026. Could you PLEASE refund my money?
HELP ME RESOLVE THIS.
THIS IS EXTREMELY POOR CUSTOMER SUPPORT.
Well shows I’m not the only one with expensive issues… how lovely.

latestComments.text: There's many other business that have much better deals these days.

Best Buy your delivery and customer service is absolutely terrible. I purchased a frame tv and delivery was an absolute nightmare! When I called, the customer service team gave me claim number to get compensation in a form of a gift card after the item was delivered now all of a sudden nobody has any notes of the gift card that was promised. Now I’m told I have to wait up to 10 days to get contacted back from the management team! Clearly there’s issues with your customer service given all the other comments I see! I will definitely be shopping Amazon and other electronic retailers moving forward! Do better!

I need someone at the corporate or district level to take responsibility for a repair that has now gone completely off the rails.

My HP Pavilion desktop was checked in at the Colerain, OH store under Work Order 1474‑251224‑82037 with a quoted 1–3 week turnaround.
I am now past the 3‑week mark, and I was just told the part was “just ordered” and the repair hasn’t even started.

During this time I have:
• Spent hours on hold
• Been disconnected twice
• Left multiple voicemails and emails with no response
• Received contradictory information from staff
• And today, a store employee admitted the District Manager refused to contact me directly and told her to call me instead

I work from home. This computer is essential to my family’s income. This delay and lack of accountability has directly impacted our livelihood.

I need:
• A real explanation for the delay
• A corrected completion date
• Direct contact from the District Manager
• And compensation for the missed service window and the impact this has caused

I’m asking publicly because every private channel has been ignored. Someone needs to step up and fix this.  @bestbuy @_geeksquad._

Sorry friends and family to burden you with a consumer post… But I’m being **cked for something that is not my problem and I’m out $1800.Best Buy bought a computer from @ Best Buy on 12/9/25. I opted for Fed Ex pickup with signature (Best Buy option). I arrived at Fed ex, signed for my package and picked up an empty box. I opened it inside the store with cameras and 4 employees present. Sure enough, packing box, and an empty laptop box. 

Fed ex said “weird that’s never happened before” and directed me to call Best Buy. Meanwhile, I never touched the box and called Best Buy immediately. After 1 hour on the phone. They apologized and offered to send a replacement to arrive 5 days later to my house. They placated me for 3 weeks, with a false sense of replacement and later refund. They never directed me to file a police report until THREE WEEKS later. 

On this day, I received a text that there were no computers in stock and my arrive date would be Jan. 1. I called and offered to buy a different model (in stock) and pay the difference to get my machine before Christmas. They told me this was not not an option bc it is a replacement. 

They later followed up on the stolen computer and asked for pictures of the beat up box and clearly re-taped shipping box. I sent them all of that. On Christmas Eve they sent me a text that they are unable to refund or replace a computer that I never received and to contact my local police precinct. 

There is no one to speak to in this division. Only customer service with outsourced calls. I have spent a total of 5 hours on the phone in 3 weeks, been hung up on, etc…

The bottom line is I never received my product, never left Fed Ex and this is all on camera. I need a full refund from the Best Buy credit card I opened to buy this $1800 computer. 

#Bestbuy #Iwillnotstop #fox5 #wsb #11alive

BEST BUY STEALS YOUR MONEY!  They hire delivery drivers that steal your product and then do not refund you and instead tell you to contact local authorities!!! NEVER have I ever experienced such incompetent, outlandish customer service before in my life.  BOYCOTT BEST BUY
